title: Severe acute respiratory syndrome–related coronavirus
summary: Severe acute respiratory syndrome–related coronavirus (SARSr-CoV or SARS-CoV)[note 1] is a species of virus consisting of many known strains phylogenetically related to severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 1 (SARS-CoV-1) that have been shown to possess the capability to infect humans, bats, and certain other mammals.[2][3] These enveloped, positive-sense single-stranded RNA viruses enter host cells by binding to the angiotensin-converting enzyme 2 (ACE2) receptor.[4] The SARSr-CoV species is a member of the genus Betacoronavirus and of the subgenus Sarbecovirus.[5][6]
